column1: 1            In peascod time when hound to horn gives ear while buck is killed
2            And little boys with pipes of corn sit keeping beasts in field
3            I went to gather strawberries tho’ when woods and groves were fair
4            And parched my face with Phoebus
5            I lay me down all by a stream and banks all overhead
6            And there I found the strangest dream
7            Methought I saw each Christmas game
8            And each thing else that man could name or might by fancy come
9            The substance of the thing I saw
10          Because I lack the skill to draw
11          But Venus shall not ’scape my pen
12          Sit feeding on the hearts of men
13          And that blind Boy sat all in blood
14          And like a conqueror he stood
15          “I have more hearts
16          “And like the deer I make them fall
17          “I do increase their wand’ring wits
column2: till that I dim their sight.

column1: 18          ” ’Tis I that do bereave them of their joy and chief delight.”
19          Thus did I see this bragging Boy advance himself even then
20          Deriding at the wanton toys
21          Which when I saw for anger then my panting breast did beat
22          To see how he sat taunting them
23          O then I wished I had been free
24          Methought I could display his arms
25          But I perforce must stay my muse
26          For that I am a subject wight
27          But if that I achieve the fort
column2: which I have took in charge

column1: 28          My hand and head with quivering quill
column2: shall blaze his name at large.
